3052230: Hepacivirus hominis (HCV) is a member of the Flaviviridae family and the Hepacivirus genus. The virus has an approximate size of 9460 nucleotides and is known to cause Hepatitis. HCV is primarily transmitted through blood and sexual contact, and it infects humans. The virus has a well-defined taxonomic position within the Flaviviridae family, contributing to its classification and understanding within clinical and microbiological studies. The confirmed data highlights its significant role in causing Hepatitis, with transmission routes clearly identified as blood and sexual contact.
